titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Swaynes were a Quaker family who lived in London Grove and Kennett, Pennsylvania. Evan Thomas Swayne (1824-1929) was the son of Benjamin and Sarah Swayne. He was married to Sarah Wayne Pusey, daughter of Jacob and Hannah (Mendenhall) Pusey of Wilmington, Delaware. The couple had four children: Edward, Laura Pusey, Anna Belle, and Charles Sumner. Evan T. Swayne was a school teacher in Octoraro, Birmingham, and London Grove. The family moved to Kennett in 1865, where Swayne took charge of a girl's boarding school, the Eaton Institute. After the school had been discontinued, the family continued to live in Kennett, and he was Clerk of Western Quarterly Meeting, Assistant Clerk of Philadelphia Yearly Meeting, and President of the Board of Managers of Martin Academy.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of scrapbooks of newspaper clippings kept by S. W. Swayne [possibly Sarah W. Swayne]. Many of the clippings are obituaries of prominent Americans, poets, and family members. Subjects include John Greenleaf Whittier, Alfred Lord Tennyson, and Bayard Taylor. Other topics include travel and Lincoln's assassination.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Swarthmore, Friends Historical Library: Norman Walton Swayne Family Papers, 1733-1987
